alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 09 at 8:50PM CDT until August 11 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Pecatonica River at Freeport affecting Stephenson County. Rock River near Joslin affecting Whiteside, Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River at Moline affecting Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Water affects some summer cottages along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 11.8 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening to 12.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening to 9.4 feet Friday evening. It will rise to 10.4 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this morning.
